docs.title: FPBase Client
docs.text: A Python client for the FPBase REST API.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
FPBase Client is a Python package that provides a convenient interface to the FPBase REST API. It allows you to:

  • Retrieve protein information
  • Search for proteins
  • Cache results locally
  • Handle rate limiting automatically

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
from fpbase_client import FPBaseAPI

# Initialize the client
client = FPBaseAPI()

# Get a specific protein
protein = client.get_protein("egfp")

# Get all proteins
proteins = client.get_all_proteins() # returns a generator of protein objects

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Simple and intuitive API
  • Automatic rate limiting
  • Local caching support
  • Comprehensive error handling

docs.title: Using pip
docs.text:
The easiest way to install FPBase Client is using pip: 

pip install fpbase-client

docs.title: From source
docs.text:
You can also install from source:

git clone https://github.com/joemans3/fpbase-client.git
cd fpbase-client
pip install -e .

docs.title: Development installation
docs.text:
For development, install with additional dependencies:

pip install -e ".[test,docs]"

docs.title: Search for Proteins
docs.text:
# Using the API client directly
api = FPBaseAPI()
proteins = api.search_by_name("GFP")  # Partial match
proteins = api.search_by_name("EGFP", partial_match=False)  # Exact match

# Using the local database (faster, works offline)
proteins = find_proteins_by_name("GFP")  # Partial match
proteins = find_proteins_by_name("EGFP", exact=True)  # Exact match

docs.title: Get Spectra Data
docs.text:
# Using the local database
spectra = find_spectra_by_name("EGFP", exact=True)
# returns a list of dictionaries with the following keys:
# name, slug, spectra
# spectra is a list of dictionaries with the following keys:
# state, ec, max, data: (state name in string, exctinction coefficient in M^-1 cm^-1, 
#                       wavelength at max excitation or emission based on state, 
#                       List[List[float, float]] representing the wavelength and 
#                       intensity of the spectrum (note: intensity is from 0-1))

docs.title: Get All Data
docs.text:
# Get all proteins
all_proteins = api.get_all_proteins()

# Get all spectra
all_spectra = api.get_all_spectra()

# Reinstall local database
from fpbase_client import reinstall_DB
reinstall_DB()  # This will delete and repopulate the local cache

docs.title: Custom Queries
docs.text:
For more specific searches, you can use the get_proteins() method with custom filters:

# Find bright green proteins
proteins = api.get_proteins(
    name__icontains='green',
    default_state__qy__gte=0.7,
    default_state__brightness__gte=0.5
)

docs.title: Available Search Fields
docs.text: The get_proteins() method supports various fields and lookups (see FPBase API docs): - name: icontains, iendswith, istartswith, iexact - seq: icontains, iendswith, istartswith, cdna_contains - default_state__ex_max: around, range, lte, gte, exact - default_state__em_max: around, range, lte, gte, exact - default_state__lifetime: gte, lte, range, exact - And many more...

docs.title: Rate Limiting
docs.text:
The client automatically handles rate limiting with a default delay of 0.5 seconds between requests. You can customize this:

client = FPBaseAPI(rate_limit_delay=1.0)  # 1 second between requests
